website_summaries.verdict: You won't get as many smarts with the Roost Smart Battery as you would with a wholesale connected replacement, but at $35, it's a viable and cost-effective option for simple, retrofit smarts.
pros: If you can install a battery, you can install the Roost Smart Battery into your existing smoke detector, and it will reliably send you push notifications when your alarm sounds
Both the battery and the app are attractively designed and easy to use
cons: Roost offers the option to "snooze" your alarm, but that won't work if your alarm is hardwired and the 9V is acting as a backup
Roost doesn't offer any interconnectivity to other smart devices
